disease: Malignant melanoma of skin of breast

symptoms.name: Black pigmented skin lesion
symptoms.pattern: May be present at birth, rapid growth and bleeding

physical_findings: 3×2-cm firm irregular mass in the upper inner quadrant of the left breast
No change in the appearance of the local skin
No discharge from, or retraction of, the nipple
Small number of lymph nodes palpated in the left axilla
2.0 × 1.5 cm ulcerative pigmented skin lesion in the right breast

imaging_findings.Breast MRI: Left breast cancer due to enlarged left axillary lymph nodes
imaging_findings.Chest CT scan: Widespread lung and pleural nodules (lung and pleural metastases)
imaging_findings.Emission CT whole body bone scintigraphy: Destruction to multiple ribs, cervical vertebrae, and thoracic bone

required: Pleomorphism of tumor cells and nuclear atypia
Positive expression of S-100, HMB-45, and Melan-A
Exclusion of tumor metastases and invasion from neighboring sites
supportive: Scattered intracellular pigment granules (although amelanotic melanoma exists)
Electron microscopy identifying melanosome and former melanosome
Absence of transition between tumor tissue and normal breast tissue
Negative expression of CK, vimentin, and SMA

differential_diagnoses: In-transit metastases to breast tissue and skin
Primary malignant melanoma of the breast gland
